1056136758788808704.text: This is why there's a distinction between "justified" and "finalized" in the spec

1056135993219276802.text: To be specific, after a crosslink for a shard is formed, one cycle worth of blocks need to receive 66% of its possible attestations for the block to be finalized. Validators are assigned in a way so that the entire validator set is assigned to a block within that one cycle.

1056135106925154304.text:
Hi Alex, nice post!

This is missing a critical component, at least when discussing Eth 2.0's design. **Finalizing** a shard block requires votes from 66% of the entire validator set, not just one committee (or 1/SHARD_COUNT of the entire set, as you imply).https://twitter.com/AlexSkidanov/status/1055509964771315717 …
